byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Stephenville, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Kathryn Jones contributed reporting from Stephenville.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Texas jury finds Eddie Ray Routh guilty in 2013 murders of former Navy SEAL sniper Chris Kyle and his friend Chad Littlefield, rejecting insanity defense; he will serve life in prison with no parole.
lead_paragraph: The defendant, Eddie Ray Routh, said he was suffering from psychosis and paranoid delusions when he fatally shot Mr. Kyle and Chad Littlefield in 2013.

headline.main: Insanity Defense Fails in Killing of the Former Navy Sniper Chris Kyle
headline.print_headline: Insanity Defense Fails in Killing of Sniper

snippet: The defendant, Eddie Ray Routh, said he was suffering from psychosis and paranoid delusions when he fatally shot Mr. Kyle and Chad Littlefield in 2013.
